result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas S Dobrinski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Unlawful Phone Use-Threatens Harm, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.012(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber.  Standard release conditions.  Court grants 29 days credit if revoked.  Consecutive to any other sentence.
Concurrent with: to any other sentence.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  No contact with the victims listed in the Criminal Complaint or their residences or places of employment.  

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Completion of Representation filed by Atty. Ricardo Tapia

02:37 PM Defendant Thomas S Dobrinski in court, in custody, with attorney Ricardo Tapia.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.
Court conducts a plea colloquy with the defendant. 
Defendant enters a plea of guilty to Count 2. 
Court finds the defendant guilty to Count 2. 
Court dismisses and reads in Count 1. 
Court dismisses and reads in Cases 21CF1662 and 22CF780. 

Court orders the following:
90 DAYS  Waukesha County Jail with Huber, all standard release conditions.
29 Days credit if revoked
Donsecutive ot any other sentence.
STAYED for PROBATION

Term of Probation: 2 YEARS concurrent to any other sentence.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
 Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
 No contact with:  victims listed in the criminal complaint or their residences or places of employment
 DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.

COSTS:  $268.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Defendant to be released forthwith.

Plea/sentencing hearing on June 29, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

09:36 AM Defendant Thomas S Dobrinski in court, in custody, with attorney Ricardo Tapia.   Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense made argument for bail motion and advised Court as to defendant's living situation upon release.  State objects to any modification of bond.  Court denies motion.  Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  State to work with Victim/Witness to ensure victims rights are in compliance.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

10:19 AM Defendant Thomas S Dobrinski in court, in custody, with attorney Ricardo Tapia.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Next date remains as previously set for June 23, 2022 at 9:00 am before Judge Paul Bugenhagen.
Bail/bond hearing on June 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.

filed by Atty. Ricardo Tapia
